intro: Selago nutans, commonly known as the leaning selago, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems that often lean towards the ground. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Its leaves are opposite, lance-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Selago nutans thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or sandy habitats.
